result.execSummary:
The defendant Marly J Regel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KO.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Credit does NOT apply.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marly J Regel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended Zero Restitution order correcting the spelling of the last name.
Defn to pay $25/mo commencing 10-15-14; initial payment of $50.
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Email from Atty Burke; set this case for plea & sentencing

Email to counsel to conduct informal final pretrial due to a change in the court's schedule and follow up with the court; if no response, the case will remain on track for trial, as currently scheduled
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Final pre-trial on July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:45
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Dennis E Burke.  Shelly Rusch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Kristina O
- Defendant shall not be at The Bridge Lounge
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 7

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
